pull.title: Draw "eye" sign at the beginning of watch-only addresses
pull.body:
This PR guaranties that the "eye" sign won't be hidden for very long addresses/labels.

No longer need to extend `TransactionOverviewWidget` widget width to make "eye" signs shown:

![Screenshot from 2021-06-15 00-21-05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/121961807-9123b600-cd70-11eb-8cdd-8b2b0d1bf44f.png)

Fixes https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/issues/373

repo.name: gui
repo.description: Bitcoin Core GUI staging repository. Please do not fork unless for development reasons.

events.body:
ACK 18ff8eb93a297eaf1aa971b77b4d5d538578f15f

Tested on `macOS 11.3 Qt 5.15.2`, `Arch Linux Qt 5.15.2` and cross-compile to `Windows 10`.

### Notes on Commits:
- [x] d476f41d5f16e3f9f6f59f358cb5649657081384

This fixes issue [#22246](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/22246), see: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/22246#issuecomment-862846748 

The below screenshots show the behavior between master and this PR when presented with more than one address in a transaction on the overview page across the major platforms.

*Note:* The before and after screenshots are taken with gui settings wiped. If a user upgrades from `v0.21.1` to `v22`, the window will open up as wide as it was on `v0.21.1`. They must then resize it to their preference, this change no longer prevents you from making the window smaller (as noted in [#22246](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/22246))
  
**macOS 11.3**
| Master      | PR         |
| -------------- | ----------- |
| ![master-issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/122339223-c9f99180-cf0e-11eb-8063-35ae95bf6f03.png) | ![test-365-resize](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/122339255-d54cbd00-cf0e-11eb-9e01-610ff71958b3.png) |

**Arch Linux**

| Master      | PR         |
| -------------- | ----------- |
| ![22246-master](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/122339371-03320180-cf0f-11eb-8760-b016c7fbc81c.png) | ![22246-pr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/122339386-09c07900-cf0f-11eb-8212-7e8d6cb7f9fa.png) |

**Windows 10**
| Master      | PR         |
| -------------- | ----------- |
| ![22246-master](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/122339481-265cb100-cf0f-11eb-9773-58a85e9841aa.png) | ![22246-pr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/122339502-2b216500-cf0f-11eb-9ea0-86d638aab20e.png) |


- [x] 18ff8eb93a297eaf1aa971b77b4d5d538578f15f

This is a nice improvement UX wise for watch only wallets. The `watch` symbol is placed on the left hand, could not force any weird behavior from this change.

Below I attach screenshots of this PR applied on the major platforms for the purposes of documentation and clarity

**macOS 11.3**
| Master      | PR         |
| -------------- | ----------- |
| ![master](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/122339848-8ce1cf00-cf0f-11eb-8f28-f73276d494b6.png) | ![pr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/122339886-99662780-cf0f-11eb-8497-b0daf43a09d6.png) |


**Arch Linux**

| Master      | PR         |
| -------------- | ----------- |
| ![365-master](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/122339950-ab47ca80-cf0f-11eb-8589-983cd726d496.png) | ![365-pr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/122339959-ae42bb00-cf0f-11eb-87ef-199281edfb1f.png) |


**Windows 10**
| Master      | PR         |
| -------------- | ----------- |
| ![365-master](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/122339997-bb5faa00-cf0f-11eb-900b-1a4db7ea59c8.png) | ![365-pr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23396902/122340013-bef33100-cf0f-11eb-9a7c-9719b6c16ef2.png) |

qt: Draw "eye" sign at the beginning of watch-only addresses

events.message: qt: Draw "eye" sign at the beginning of watch-only addresses

events.body: ACK cd46c11577a05f3dc9eac94f27a6985f6ba0509e Tested only on macOS 11.3 Changes since last review: > addressed @luke-jr's comment Conceptually it does make sense to not use text elements in drawing of visual elements. Confirmed that this still fixes #373 (previously #22246) **Transactions Tab Issue** | Master | PR | | ------- | --- | | | | **Watch-Only Symbol** | Master | PR | | ------- | --- | | | |

comments.body: Is this assuming spaces have a certain width?

Offset the bounding rect?

Spaces are never a well-defined width... except zero-width :)
Offset in fixed number of pixels? Is it a good approach with potentially scalable fonts?

Measure the icon width.

Scalable fonts is exactly why spaces won't work reliably. ;)

> Is this assuming spaces have a certain width?

Thanks! [Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/365#issuecomment-869523331).
